name: market for silky fibre | silky fibre | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22987/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'silky fibre', in the the Global geography. This is a generic market; the suppliers of this market make available this generic product by redirecting a part of the production of several more specific products.;This dataset is a consumption mix represending the supply of silky fibres, from activities that produce it, to activities that consume it within the geography of this dataset, Global. No transport is considered in this market.;Silky fibre is a fibre that has a shiny texture and appearence. It can have a man-made origin or a natural origin.

The activity starts at the place where silky fibres are produced.

The activity ends with the provision of silky fibres to its respective consumers.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/203:Manufacture of man-made fibres/2030:Manufacture of man-made fibres
